info.name: Mobile Money Simulator API
info.description:
This document defines the RESTful endpoints provided by the GSMA Mobile Money API
You can find out more about what the API can do for your business at
[https://developer.mobilemoneyapi.io]

header.description: Header parameter to indicate the date and time that the message was originated. It is used for basic message integrity checks, to ensure the request is not stale. Note that the header was previously referenced as 'Date' in version 1.0 of the Mobile Money API.
Used to pass pre-shared client's API key to the server.
Used to pass user’s access token when OAuth 2.0/OIDC authorisation framework is used for end-user authentication
Used to pass pre-shared client's identifier to the server.
SHA-256 hex digest of the request content (encrypted or plain). Applicable only if basic data integrity checking is to be performed.
The end-users encrypted security credential. Should only be used when OAuth 2.0/OIDC authorisation framework has not been implemented by the API Provider.
The end-users encrypted security credential Should only be used when OAuth 2.0/OIDC authorisation framework has not been implemented by the API Provider.
String containing the channel that was used to originate the request. For example USSD, Web, App.

A header variable that identifies the type of the account holding institution. This header is used to support request routing and should be used in conjunction with the X-Account-Holding-Institution-Identifier header.

A header variable that identifies the account holding institution. This header is used to support request routing and should be used in conjunction with the X-Account-Holding-Institution-Identifier-Type header.

variable.description: (Required) Path variable to uniquely identify the transaction.

request.description: This endpoint returns the details of a transaction

response.name: Represents an Error Caused by a Failure to Identify the Target Resource

Valid account identifiers are accountcategory, bankaccountno, accountrank, identityalias, iban, accountid, msisdn, swiftbic, sortcode, organisationid, username, walletid, linkref, consumerno, serviceprovider, storeid, bankname, bankaccounttitle, emailaddress, mandatereference.

Example: organisationid@1234$accountid@3333. Valid account identifiers are accountcategory, bankaccountno, accountrank, identityalias, iban, accountid, msisdn, swiftbic, sortcode, organisationid, username, walletid, linkref, consumerno, serviceprovider, storeid, bankname, bankaccounttitle, emailaddress, mandatereference.

Example: organisationid@1234$accountid@3333.
